page.title: 16MAJOR GENERAL GRAHAM
page.content: MajorGeneral F.C.C. Graham C.B.,D.S.O. of Mackeanston House, Doune was born in Helensburgh on 14-12-1908. Educated at Eton and R.M.C. Sandhurst he was gazetted to the Argyll and Sutherland Highlanders on 31-1-29. He served in China,India,Palestine,Western Desert, Crete,Syria and Italy. From 1944-45 he commanded the 1st Battalion A.& S.H. After the war his many important army posts included Colonel of A.& S.H.from 1958-72. He was promoted MajorGeneral to command Highland District & 51st Highland Division.General Graham is a member of the Royal Company of Archers -the Queen's Bodyguard for Scotland. His civic posts have included Deputy Lieutenant & County Councillor,PERTH; District Councillor & Vice-Convenor, STIRLING.The highlight of his civic career was his appointment as H.M.Lord Lieutenant CENTRAL REGION 1979-83.
